articles.description: Crypto majors bounce with stocks & gold after CPI. Kamala odds flip Trump after Presidential debate. SUI, FTM, ICP, TON lead gains in Alt L1s. ETH dominance falls to 14%, lowest level in 3 years. AI coins strong as Nvidia & chip optimism returns. SWIFT set to build infrastructure for RWA trading. Coinbase launches wrapped Bitcoin product. ENS integrated with Venmo & PayPal. Pendle introduces Bitcoin yield pools at 45%. POPCAT gets Kraken listing, leads top SOL memes. SUNDOG breaks $300m after ByBit spot listing. Casino tokens rise, RLB up 100% in 2 weeks. Ape Punk sells in ‘heist’ for 10ETH. XCOPY editions & 1/1s see high sales. Fantasy Top trading volume continues to grow. Trump family set to launch crypto project Monday.

Now the marketplace is pushing forward with a digital wallet that bridges Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana as it eyes other future expansions. Lu discusses Magic Eden's evolution since its early days, along with valuable lessons learned in the turbulent crypto industry.
articles.title: Why CEO Jack Lu Is Pushing Magic Eden Beyond NFTs

articles.description: Crypto rises with stocks after CPI falls again. Bitfinex BTC longs continue to grow. SUI again leads L1s, up 18%. FTX estate unstakes $24m SOL, still has $943m. Binance introduces SOL liquid staking. SWIFT introduces infrastructure for RWA transfers. Pendle launches Bitcoin yield pools. UK makes crypto legal property. India leads crypto adoption for second year. Vitalik won’t advertise L2s with multi-sig security. Based rollups seen as alternative future for ETH. Blockchain music start up raises $50m. Ford & Toyota file blockchain patents.

articles.description: Crypto falls slightly after Presidential debate. Exchanges see highest BTC outflow since May. Be wary of Yen move for BTC: Hayes. SOL active addresses hit ATH. At least 5 massive SOL announcements coming: Mert. Binomial to introduce restaking on BNB. Indonesian exchange hacked for $22m. Atomic Wallet wins lawsuit over $100m hack. Lawyers argue Ellison shouldn’t go to jail. ENS integrated with Venmo & PayPal. Galaxy & State Street launch 3 crypto ETFs. Standard Chartered begins UAE crypto custody. AAVE leads resurgence in DeFi coins.

Wealth advisors quickly adopting BTC: BitWise CEO. Binance among few firms to get Indonesia license. Spot trading on CEXs up 30% in August. SEC made $4.68bn from crypto firms in 2023. $5.6bn lost to scams in 2023. XRP security status may be unchallenged in appeal. EtherFi announces credit card on Scroll. Base has more DEX users than other L2s combined. Tether & Tron create taskforce against crime. TIA still only making $585 in daily fees. WLD investigated by Singapore police.

BTC RSI hits lowest level since July 2021. Bitfinex longs continue to grow aggressively. BTC hashrate hits another ATH. BTC could hit $90k on Trump election: Bernstein. Farcaster DAU’s down 95%.

Its owner later adopted another Shiba Inu called Neiro which caused a long blockchain civil war with multiple tokens battling it out for liquidity. Now a month later SlumDOGE, the man who became a millionaire off Dogecoin (but never sold), explains why Neiro is a moment for the dog coin community to unite.

articles.author: Tareq Sikder
articles.description:
The DLT Science Foundation (DSF) has announced its support  
for the launch of the MiCA Crypto Alliance, which includes Hedera, Ripple, and  
Aptos Foundation as founding members. 
This new association aims to facilitate compliance with the  
European Union's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulation, set to take full  
effect by the end of this year.
MiCA Demands Climate Disclosures
MiCA is designed to create a comprehensive regulatory  
framework for the cryptocurrency market. It seeks to ensure transparency,  
consumer protection, and market integrity. The regulation includes strict  
disclosure requirements, particularly concerning the climate impact of crypto  
operations, which must be detailed in publicly accessible white papers and  
website descriptions.
Commenting on the launch …
articles.title: MiCA Crypto Alliance Teams Up with DSF to Nail Down Regulatory Compliance

articles.author: Terence Zimwara
articles.description: The Nigerian Institute of Social and Economic Research (NISER) partnered with Soramitsu, a Japanese tech firm, to improve NISER’s research faculty’s knowledge of blockchain technology. Soramitsu will focus on specific areas like SORA, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), and Hyperledger Iroha. This partnership aims to create a knowledge base and support Nigeria’s development through research […]
articles.title: Nigerian Think Tank, Japanese Tech Firm Partner on Blockchain Research

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
The Bitcoin market has been closely analyzed by a CryptoQuant analyst named Percival, who recently provided insights into Bitcoin’s realized cap and net capital flows.
 
The realized cap is a metric that tracks each Bitcoin (UTXO) when it was last moved on the network, effectively representing the cost basis of all circulating coins. This metric helps to understand whether there is an inflow or outflow of net capital in the Bitcoin market.
 
 
Bitcoin Realized Cap Sees Stagnation
 
According to Percival in a recent post on the CryptoQuant QuickTake platform, as of now, BTC’s realized cap stands at $461 billion, reflecting a modest increase of $3 billion, or 0.66%, indicating low movement and a stagnant net capital inflow.
 
To understand what this stagnation means for BTC, Percival identif…
articles.title: Bitcoin’s Realized Cap Stagnates: What Does This Mean For BTC?

articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
As the world’s largest asset manager and issuer of crypto exchange-traded funds (ETFs), BlackRock, solidifies its foothold in the industry, the firm’s Head of Digital Assets, Robbie Mitchnick, recently made interesting statements on key issues regarding BlackRock’s position and vision of the financial landscape. 
 
In a recent interview with Bankless, Mitchnick outlined BlackRock’s strategy for engaging with crypto assets and the potential of tokenization in the broader financial sector.
 
Key Factors Driving Institutional Interest In Crypto
 
BlackRock’s increasing engagement with cryptocurrency over the past few years stems from several pivotal factors. First and foremost, the institutionalization of crypto has gained serious momentum. 
 
According to Mitchnick, this shift is accompanied…
articles.title: Exploring BlackRock’s Crypto Strategy: Insights From Head Of Digital Assets

articles.author: Sergio Goschenko
articles.description: Circle, a financial services company, and Sony Block Solutions Labs, a Sony Group company, have partnered to launch USDC, a dollar-pegged stablecoin, on Soneium, an Ethereum L2 blockchain. The collaboration includes the launch of Bridged USDC on Soneium to be part of the economy of the emergent ecosystem, becoming a primary token for value exchange. […]
articles.title: Circle Partners With Sony to Introduce USDC on Soneium

articles.author: Sam Reynolds
articles.description: BitGo says USDS is an "open participation" stablecoin that provides rewards to institutions for providing liquidity to the ecosystem.
articles.title: BitGo to Enter Stablecoin Market With Reward-Bearing USDS Coin
